content:
Check:
  all:
    # TODO: this is NOT a correct implementation yet!
    - name: SPECIES
      operator: is_not_unique_set
      value:
        - DOMAIN
        - SETCD
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.309
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: DM records with different values for SPECIES may not have the same SETCD
  value.
Outcome:
  Message: The same SETCD is assigned to different SPECIES
  Output Variables:
    - SPECIES
    - SETCD
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '309'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Trial Sets (TX) can have multiple species and/or strains
                  if they are different by set. DM records with different values for
                  SPECIES cannot have the same SETCD value.
                Document: IG v3.1
                Section: 6.3.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - SPECIAL-PURPOSE
  Domains:
    Include:
      - DM

json.Description: DM records with different values for SPECIES may not have the same SETCD value.

Outcome.Message: The same SETCD is assigned to different SPECIES

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Trial Sets (TX) can have multiple species and/or strains if they are different by set. DM records with different values for SPECIES cannot have the same SETCD value.
